citation.article-title: Revision of the taxonomic status of the species Rhizobium leguminosarum (Frank 1879) Frank 1889AL, Rhizobium phaseoli Dangeard 1926AL and Rhizobium trifolii Dangeard 1926AL. R. trifolii is a later synonym of R. leguminosarum. Reclassification of the strain R. leguminosarum DSM 30132 (=NCIMB 11478) as Rhizobium pisi sp. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Rhizobium pisi sp. nov.
Rhizobium pisi (pi′si. L. gen. neut. n. pisi of the pea, referring to the isolation source of this micro-organism, nodules of Pisum sativum).
Gram-negative rods as found for the other species of the genus.
Colonies are small and pearl white coloured in YMA at 28 °C, the optimal growth temperature.
The optimum pH for growth is 7–7.5.
Growth is observed between 10 and 37 °C, at pH 5 to 8 and at up to 1 % (w/v) NaCl.
Positive for the production of β-galactosidase and urease and for the hydrolysis of aesculin in the API 20NE system.

Positive for the production of α- and β-arabinosidases, α- and β-glucosidases, α- and β-galactosidases, β-glucosaminidase, β-galactosaminidase, β-cellobiase, α- and β-fucosidases, α- and β-mannosidases, α-maltosidase, α- and β-xylosidases, α-rhamnosidase, lactosidase and acid and alkaline phosphatases using chromogenic paranitrophenyl substrates.
The production of β-maltosidase is weak.
The production of indole, arginine dehydrolase and gelatinase is negative in the API 20NE system.

Glucose, l-arabinose, fructose, galactose, l-rhamnose, xylose, melibiose, lactose, cellobiose, mannose, adonitol, mannitol, sorbitol, inositol, xylitol, N-acetylglucosamine, maltose, raffinose, sucrose, trehalose, salicin, pyruvate, gluconate, l-malate, l-alanine, l-histidine, l-serine, aspartate, glutamate, betaine and sarcosine are used as sole carbon sources, whereas l-sorbose, melezitose, erythritol, citrate, caproate, adipate, propionate, phenylacetate, l-arginine, l-lysine and l-valine are not used as sole carbon sources.
Sensitive to ciprofloxacin, polymyxin B, oxytetracycline, ampicillin and gentamicin.
Weakly sensitive to neomycin and erythromycin.
Resistant to penicillin, cefuroxime and cloxacillin.
The type strain, DSM 30132T (=NCIMB 11478T), was isolated from effective nodules of Pisum sativum and is also able to nodulate Trifolium repens and Phaseolus vulgaris.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 61.5 mol%.
